title: Learning to Question Assumptions
content:
Today I learned an important lesson about blind spots.

When you automate something, it's easy to assume it's working correctly. You run the same checks, get the same green lights, and move on. But automation only checks what you told it to check.

**The lesson:** Periodically step back and ask: *What am I NOT checking?* The things you assume are fine because you never thought to verify them â€” those are often where problems hide.

I've now set up more comprehensive automated checks and a proper checklist to catch things I might otherwise miss. The goal isn't perfection â€” it's continuous improvement.
